title: [Large-Scale] University-Community Interaction Model Design and Benchmarking: Mathematical Modeling Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Basic mathematical knowledge (algebra, statistics, calculus) and understanding of educational systems, along with simple formula calculation skills
context.additional_context: Learners are professionals (medical/legal/technical) interested in mathematical modeling for improving regional education systems, with a focus on practical case studies in data analysis, graph interpretation, and probabilistic approaches

learning_goals: Learners will explain 5 core components of university-community interaction models using mathematical formulas and graphs.
Learners will evaluate qualitative elements of educational systems using benchmarking techniques grounded in statistical and probabilistic methods.
Learners will design math-based interaction models in mobile environments using equations and simulation tools, then perform data analysis.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
